definition: to implicate/implicated/to link together
to lead along/to pull (an animal on a tether)/(bound form) to involve/to draw in
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
surname Lian

sentences.english: There are many cases of human rights violations filed before the police.
sentences.chinese: 警方接手许多人权侵犯案件，往往牵连到高级官员。

sentences.english: The speech that gets embroil is more.
Don't embroil me in your quarrel.
sentences.chinese: 别把我牵连进你们的争吵之中。

sentences.english: To reach out is ---to risk involvement.
sentences.chinese: 与他人交往，你是在冒险，你会有无数牵连。

sentences.english: He cannot arbitrate,because he is interested in the matter.
sentences.chinese: 他不能做仲裁，因为他与这事有牵连。

sentences.english: The police found a letter which implicated him in the robbery.
sentences.chinese: 察发现了一封信，这封信把他牵连到抢劫案中。

sentences.english: This problem is extensive, and immediate good solution may not be easily accessed to.
sentences.chinese: 这问题牵连得非常广泛，一时恐难获得良好的解决。

sentences.english: Thread safety also has performance implications at run time.
sentences.chinese: 线程安全在运行时还具有性能牵连。

sentences.english: I suspect that he is more or less involved in the affair.
sentences.chinese: 我猜他和这件事有点牵连。

sentences.english: I don't want you to be invloved in their family affair. It's none of your business.
sentences.chinese: 我不想要你牵连到他们的家务事中去，这不关你的事。

sentences.english: You would hamper yourself with that fellow.
sentences.chinese: 你会受到那个家伙的牵连。

sentences.english: They seem embarrassed to be linked with the Raelians.
sentences.chinese: 他们看来为与拉耶尔教派牵连在一起而感到尴尬。

sentences.english: Why did you embroil innocent, ordinary civilians?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么要牵连无辜的平民？

sentences.english: MicroRNAs have been implicated in regulating diverse cellular pathways.
sentences.chinese: 在调节不同的细胞通路的小分子RNA有牵连。

sentences.english: If so, he could bring Mr Ozawa under suspicion, too.
sentences.chinese: 果真如此，他也会牵连嫌疑到小泽一郎。

sentences.english: These 3 types of desires all overlap eachother.

definition: to involve/implicated
to weigh down/to trouble/to implicate (sb)/tied down (by affairs)
to involve/to implicate/to be interrelated
to involve/to implicate sb/to spread to others (harm, trouble, damage etc)
to involve others (in a crime)/guilt by association
variant of 牽連|牵连[qian1 lian2]
responsibility
to commit a crime
to be drawn into/to be involved in
to entrap/to set up/to frame (up)/to make false charges against
to spread to/to involve/to affect
to exterminate an entire family
to frame/to bring false charges against
connection/association/involvement
(of an official) to lose one's job
to offend sb/to give offense/to displease
